name: plashing
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the action or sound of water moving or hitting something: The plashing of the water was soothing after the noise and petrol fumes of the bus ride. The fountain was making a constant tinkle and plashing in a wide marble basin.

agriculture
  UK specialized the act of twisting branches together in a line of trees or a hedge (= a line of bushes planted very close together, especially along the edge of a garden, field, or road): Without plashing, the hedge will decay and grow thin at the bottom.
(of a liquid) moving or hitting something in a way that makes a noise: The rain beat fast and furiously outside, and ran down from the roof in plashing streams. I dreamt of glorious suns, burning skies, waving trees, and plashing streams.
